data.title: Syracuse, NY Private Catholic School
data.meta_description: Bishop Ludden Junior-Senior High School, located in Syracuse, NY, is one of the top performing, private Catholic schools within the Diocese of Syracuse. The school exists to further the mission of Jesus Christ by teaching & proclaiming the Gospel, according to the sacramental life of the Roman Catholic Church.

Challenge Announcement on Giving Day!

The Comprehensive Campaign has now raised $1.5 million and we have an exciting new challenge pledge, in memory of Heather Ann (Gould) Williams ’81!

The Comprehensive Campaign is a $2 million ambitious Scholarship and Academic Program Enhancement Campaign that will provide for the long-term financial health and academic strength of the school.

This Campaign will open up the opportunity to attend Bishop Ludden to all qualified students desiring a college preparatory education through additional scholarship monies raised.

Learn More

Check out what Bishop Ludden and Most Holy Rosary Schools have to offer in the Diocese of Syracuse!

Now Offering the International Baccalaureate Diploma Program

Investing in a Bishop Ludden education is investing in your future. This is true now more than ever as we are now recognized as an International Baccalaureate school! The IB Diploma is offered in addition to the traditional NYS Diploma and is held in very high regard by colleges and universities across the world. IB is recognized for its innovative approach to education, placing an equal focus on academics and other transferable skills, in order to best prepare students for success beyond high school.

Learn More

What Students Are Saying

What Parents Are Saying

What Alumni Are Saying

"Bishop Ludden is a great school all around. Because of the small class sizes, my teachers are able to work at a pace that's best for my class. I can also try out new sports and clubs, because there isn't as much competition or pressure as there is at other schools. The support system is great. We're not just a group of students - we're a family."

"As an alum, parent, coach and Board member, I am excited to see that Bishop Ludden has taken the initiative to enhance their academic programs and provide students with numerous opportunities to flourish in and outside of the classroom."

-Thomas Royal, Class of 1982

"Bishop Ludden provides more than just a traditional classroom education. There's a sense of community, a dedication to helping others, and a deep commitment to integrity that's instilled in all Gaelic Knights - traits that have continued to serve me well both personally and professionally."

Patrick Mooney, '89
